data.chText: （天主教、圣公会、东正教的）司祭，神父，司铎
data.enText: a person who is qualified to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Roman Catholic, Anglican and Orthodox Churches

data.chText: （非基督教会的）教士，祭司，僧侣
data.enText: a person who performs religious ceremonies in some religions that are not Christian

word_means: 使成为教士；任命…为祭司[神父]

means: (天主教、圣公会、东正教的)司祭，神父，司铎
(非基督教会的)教士，祭司，僧侣
使成为教士；任命…为祭司[神父]

tr: a clergyman in Christian churches who has the authority to perform or administer various religious rites
a person who performs religious duties and ceremonies in a non-Christian religion

value.def: A priest is a member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church.

example.ex: He had trained to be a Catholic priest.
example.tran: 他受训成为了一名天主教神父。

value.tran: 基督教教士；（天主教）神父；（英国圣公会）牧师；（东正教）司铎

value.def: In many non-Christian religions a priest is a man who has particular duties and responsibilities in a place where people worship.
value.tran: （非基督教会的）教士，和尚，僧侣，祭司

trans: 犹大圣徒；犹大牧师；犹大祭司；犹太祭司；犹太祭司乐团
李·普瑞斯特；李普瑞斯特
符文牧师；符咒牧师；符文祭司；神符祭司
